meanings.definition: Having a margin with rounded or scalloped projections.
meanings.sent1: The crenated edges of the paper gave it a decorative look.
meanings.sent2: The baker created a crenated pattern on the pie crust.
meanings.sent3: The crenated cookies looked like little waves of sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The crenated clouds in the sky resembled fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: The crenated design on the dress made it stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To form a series of rounded projections along an edge.
meanings.sent1: She carefully crenated the dough before baking it.
meanings.sent2: The artist crenated the clay to create a unique texture.
meanings.sent3: The kids crenated the sandcastle edges for a fancy touch.
meanings.sent4: The wind crenated the sand dunes along the beach.
meanings.sent5: The chef crenated the vegetables for an elegant presentation.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the leaves crenated along the edges.
meanings.sent2: The metal crenated as it was exposed to the elements.
meanings.sent3: The fabric crenated after being washed multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The old book pages crenated from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The wooden fence crenated due to weathering and age.
